other_tests.findings: Gallbladder is moderately distended with three large gallstones up to 2.2 cm. One stone likely impacted at the gallbladder neck. There is gallbladder wall edema and a small amount of pericholecystic fluid. Mild hepatic hyperemia along the margin of the gallbladder. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. A tiny central filling defect in the distal common hepatic duct likely represents artifact. The pancreatic duct is normal. Simple cysts in the liver with mild fatty infiltration.
